intro: Diodia sarmentosa var. bisepala, commonly known as the twin-sepal diodia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with hairy surfaces. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral morphology, featuring two prominent sepals that are fused at the base.
